intro: Dilkea retusa, commonly known as the smooth dilkea, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with slender, branching stems. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months.
